description: Sum of two nonzero rational cubes.
comments: n such that x^3 + y^3 = n*z^3 has a solution in nonnegative integers x,y,z.
links: S. R. Finch, On a Generalized Fermat-Wiles Equation
mathematica: (* A naive program with a few pre-computed terms *) nmax = 120; xmax = 2000; CubeFreePart[n_] := Times @@ Power @@@ ({#[[1]], Mod[#[[2]], 3]} & /@ FactorInteger[n]); nn = Reap[Do[n = CubeFreePart[x*y*(x+y)]; If[1 < n <= nmax, Sow[n]], {x, 1, xmax}, {y, x, xmax}]][[2, 1]] // Union; A020897 = Select[ Union[nn, nn*2^3, nn*3^3, nn*4^3, {17, 31, 53, 67, 71, 79, 89, 94, 97, 103, 107}], # <= nmax &]}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Apr 02 2012 *)
author: _Steven Finch_
